articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: Tokyo Disneyland closes down over coronavirus
articles.description: Universal Studios Japan and Legoland Japan also shut their gates.

articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: First coronavirus-related drug shortage hits U.S.
articles.description: The manufacturing shortage likely won’t be the last.

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: A dog in Hong Kong has tested ‘weak positive’ for coronavirus
articles.description: If confirmed, the dog would be the first case of a pet catching the coronavirus amid a global outbreak.

articles.author: Jenna Schnuer
articles.title: Google cancels major Las Vegas conference over coronavirus concerns
articles.description: The sales and marketing conference would have brought 1000s of company employees together in Las Vegas.

articles.author: kdunn6
articles.title: Switzerland cancels events and Germany puts town under quarantine as coronavirus spreads across Europe
articles.description: Switzerland canceled large events as Europe steps up measures to contain the spread of the coronavirus. Public and private gatherings with more than 1,000 people won’t be allowed until March 15, the Swiss government said on Friday. The next big event in the c…

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: Singapore’s coronavirus response has contained the outbreak—but its strategy is hard to replicate
articles.description: The Asian city-state is emerging as a litmus test of whether the deadly pathogen can be, if not contained, then neutralized.

articles.author: Grady McGregor
articles.title: As coronavirus goes global, China defends its ‘strong’ leadership and challenges the West to match its resolve
articles.description: The outbreak script has suddenly flipped, and some in China appear vindicated by the moment.

articles.author: Jenna Schnuer
articles.title: Apple’s Tim Cook says coronavirus-driven supply chain changes are temporary
articles.description: But Cook added that he's also tracking the coronavirus situation in Korea and Italy since Apple has suppliers and businesses in those countries too.

articles.author: Lucinda Shen
articles.title: Amidst coronavirus panic, the stock of this hazmat suit-maker is up 88%
articles.description: Investors are taking a renewed interest in companies that specialize in keeping people protected—from other people.

articles.author: Anne Sraders
articles.title: Coronavirus crackdown: How companies like Ernst & Young are going to extremes to avoid infections
articles.description: Ernst & Young is requiring employees to request to attend "client-critical" meetings of over 100 attendees, according to an email viewed by Fortune.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: How to think about COVID-19
articles.description: A reflection on scapegoating and discrimination in the time of coronavirus.

articles.author: Defne Gencler
articles.title: U.S. stocks tumble 11% in worst week since 2008 crisis
articles.description: The spread of the coronavirus rattled global financial markets, wiping out almost $3 trillion in value from American equities.

articles.author: David Meyer
articles.title: We haven’t reached the bottom yet
articles.description: With coronavirus pandemic fears continuing to hammer markets around the world, this is set to be the worst week since 2008.
